enWisdom: Piety is a shield against evil deeds
God-wariness is the fortress of the believer
God-wariness is a safeguard for the one who adopts it
God-wariness is the strongest fortress and the most protective sanctuary

Wisdom: التَّقْوَى حِصْنٌ حَصِينٌ لِمَنْ لَجَأَ إِلَيْهِ
enWisdom: God-wariness is a fortified stronghold for the one who takes refuge in it

Wisdom: التَّقْوَى آكَدُ سَبَبٍ بَيْنَكَ وَبَيْنَ اللَّهِ إِنْ أَخَذْتَ بِهِ وَجُنَّةٌ مِنْ عَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ
enWisdom: God-wariness is the strongest connection between yourself and Allah if you hold on to it, and it is a shield against the painful chastisement [of the Hereafter]

Wisdom: الْجَئُوا إِلَى التَّقْوَى فَإِنَّهُ [فَإِنَّهَا] جُنَّةٌ مَنِيعَةٌ مَنْ لَجَأَ إِلَيْهَا حَسَّنَتْهُ وَمَنِ اعْتَصَمَ بِهَا عَصَمَتْهُ
enWisdom: Turn to God-wariness, for indeed it is an impenetrable shieldWhoever turns to it, it protects him and whoever holds on to it, it preserves him
The most impenetrable fortress of religion is God-wariness

Wisdom: إِنَّ التَّقْوَى دَارُ حِصْنٍ عَزِيزٍ لِمَنْ لَجَأَ إِلَيْهِ [إِلَيْهَا] وَالْفُجُورَ دَارُ حِصْنٍ ذَلِيلٍ لَا يُحْرِزُ أَهْلَهُ وَلَا يَمْنَعُ مَنْ لَجَأَ إِلَيْهِ
enWisdom: Verily God-wariness is a strong fortress [of protection] for the one who takes refuge in it, and impiety is the dilapidated fortress [of humiliation] which does not protect its people and does not offer security to the one who takes refuge in it
Espouse piety, for it is indeed the best protection

Wisdom: مَنْ تَوَرَّعَ عَنِ الشَّهَوَاتِ صَانَ نَفْسَهُ
enWisdom: Whoever shuns lustful desires has safeguarded his soul
There is no stronghold more protective than piety
There is no fortress more impenetrable than God-wariness

Wisdom: لَا صِيَانَةَ لِمَنْ لَا وَرَعَ لَهُ
enWisdom: There is no safeguard for the one who has no piety
